__e: Listen brother, I didn't do what they say.
Reverend, I appreciate everything that you're doing and everything that you said, but I'm not on a mission.
You know, Reverend, I think the Lord is trying to give us some true words through this brother here.
Reverend, you've got your job, and I've got mine.
Ah, reverend, you are a man of god, more or less.
Just do as the reverend tells you and you'll all be outside, playing, soon, hmm?
And well you might be when the son of clergy is permitted to the table before a lady of the house.
Perhaps the reverend is too nice for me.
Yeah, and I hope the Reverend's ready, Cause I got about a zillion questions for him.
If the reverend has questions, he should ask me himself.
The reverend said you murdered a man.
Seems the reverend has a dream... a vision of me in the mayor's office, you at the chief's desk.
Ah, well, um, I know that you already know the reverend and his wife.
It's not your fault, not my fault, not the good reverend doctor's fault; and it ain't got nothin' to do with the devil.
Your father's going to speak to the parson, and then we'll see what's to be done.
